title: Hurricane Otis unleashes massive flooding in Acapulco
summary: Mexican authorities rushed to send emergency aid and assess damage in the Pacific beach resort of Acapulco on Wednesday after the powerful hurricane severed communications and road links. Experts are calling Otis the strongest storm in history to make landfall along the Eastern Pacific Coast.

title: Mike Johnson elected US House speaker with broad Republican support
summary: The choice of Johnson – a lesser-known conservative who has the support of Donald Trump – ends weeks of tumult over the leadership role.

title: After initial prudence, Erdogan calls Hamas a 'group of liberators'
summary: In September, the Turkish president met with the Israeli prime minister for the first time in a decade. On Saturday, he will attend a major rally for Gaza in Istanbul.

title: Israel-Hamas war: 'There can be no victory over terrorism without the prospect of peace and freedom for Palestinians'
summary: Speaking out about the horrors committed by Hamas must be a prerequisite for any debate on the Palestinian issue. But it does not justify ignoring the historical and political context in which these atrocities took place, writes MEP Raphaël Glucksmann.

title: Moroccans mobilize for Gaza despite the rapprochement between Rabat and Tel Aviv
summary: Since October 15, support for Gaza has continued to spread in many cities, led by coalitions of left-wing parties, trade unions, civil associations and Islamist organizations.

title: Enigma of Mars' internal structure finally solved
summary: Two studies published Wednesday in the journal 'Nature' conclude that there is a 150-kilometer-thick layer of magma in the lower part of the mantle surrounding the Red Planet's core.

title: Israel PM Netanyahu says will 'have to give answers' on Hamas attacks lapses
summary: The Israeli Prime Minister has faced a barrage of opposition and media criticism after Gaza militants breached Israeli border defenses. He acknowledged for the first time on Wednesday that 'the fault will be examined and everyone will have to give answers, including me.'

title: New York judge fines Trump $10,000 over a comment he made outside court in his civil fraud trial
summary: The judge presiding over Donald Trump's civil fraud trial imposed the fine, Trump's second, after determining that comments he made to reporters during a break in the trial violated a partial gag order issued three weeks ago.

title: Fake bomb threats: An old phenomenon feeding into prevailing anxiety
summary: Since the murder of a teacher by a terrorist earlier this month, French authorities have opened 64 investigations into bomb threats targeting airports, schools and museums. The firm response, including many evacuations, has had the unwanted consequence of publicizing the trend.

title: Tour de France: 2024 Florence-Nice route announced
summary: The new route is set to include 3,492 km of road, two Alpine crossings, a time trial finish from Monaco, and the highest starting altitude of any Tour de France.

title: US forces face upsurge in attacks in Iraq and Syria
summary: Since October 17, at least 13 armed drone and rocket attacks have targeted bases belonging to the United States and international coalition bases against the Islamic State group.

title: Macron surprises leaders with proposal to 'fight Hamas' with international coalition against IS
summary: The French president's suggestion, made during his visit to Israel, appears highly inflammatory in the Arab world. Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, meanwhile, saw it as a symbolic offer.

title: 'Bring them home': In Tel Aviv, hostages' families camp in front of Israeli military's HQ
summary: Relatives of people held by Hamas are keeping up the pressure on the Israeli government to make their release a priority over a ground invasion of Gaza.

title: Victor Wembanyama to shine a spotlight on fellow French NBA players
summary: After years without a major sensation, French basketball is set to grab the attention of the American public thanks to the emergence of 'Wemby.' Here are the French players to watch in this NBA season.

title: Democratic debate, a virtue in wartorn Ukraine
summary: After the sacred unity of the first few months of the war, Ukraine's citizens are not afraid to protest and express their opinions, as in any democratic society.

title: Austrian far-right figures' trip to visit Taliban in Afghanistan raises eyebrows at home
summary: A former Freedom Party of Austria MEP and three party-affiliated individuals visited Afghanistan in late September, and were received as an official delegation, leaving Austria surprised and their far-right party's leader appalled.

title: Britney Spears reveals the woman within
summary: 'The Woman in Me,' the pop star's autobiography, hit bookstores worldwide on Tuesday, October 24. It sheds light on her hypersexualized adolescence, pressure to abort and guardianship by her father – reflecting modern American society.

title: To our readers: On Le Monde's coverage of the explosion at the Al Ahli Arab Hospital in Gaza
summary: Le Monde looks back at the newsroom's coverage of the deadly explosion at the Al Ahli hospital in Gaza on October 17.

title: Aboriginal tourism in Canada: a boon for First Nations
summary: As Canadians slowly come to terms with the traumas of their colonial history, the tourism industry is now inviting travelers to immerse themselves in the culture of the land's original inhabitants.

title: At least 10 dead in Maine shootings
summary: According to the police, a man opened fire Wednesday at two locations in Lewiston. The suspect is still at large.

title: In Spain, Princess Leonor breathes new life into the monarchy
summary: The heiress to the throne is conscientiously preparing to reign. On October 31, her 18th birthday, she will swear an oath of loyalty to the Constitution. She already seems to have won over the Spaniards.

title: US auto workers union reaches preliminary deal with Ford
summary: The agreement reached on Wednesday, which rank-and-file workers must still approve in a vote, includes a 25% wage increase for hourly employees. Other key elements include guaranteed cost-of-living adjustments, an elimination of different pay levels or 'tiers' that disadvantage junior employees and a right to strike over plant closures.

title: Bolivia forest fires shutter thousands of schools
summary: Some 3,650 schools – about 15% of the national total – have been closed until Friday, the Bolivian government told reporters. The work of firefighters has been made more difficult by a shortage of water in the midst of drought.
